page.title: 06THE TYNE TUNNELS
page.content: There are two tunnels linking Jarrow and Howdon,under the River Tyne.The pedestrian tunnel,when opened in 1951,had the longest single escalator in the world.There is also a lift at each end so that people with prams can use the tunnel.The Tyne Traffic Tunnel was completed in 1967 at a cost of &21,000,000 and was built to cope with the increase in traffic that used the Great North Road that ran through Gateshead and Newcastle.A tunnel was built because the Tyne is wide at this point and a bridge would have cost more.Buses,lorries,cars and motorbikes use the tunnel.A toll is charged for each vehicle and the current charges are:buses and lorries 80p,cars 40p and motorbikes 20p.
